name: React-android-audio-player
tagline: A simple streaming music player for Android built using React Native
body:
### How to install React Native for Android

Android Development with React Native
=
The first step to building a React Native app for Android is to install and configure the necessary tools for Mac. For many new developers, this process can seem unwieldy so here's a cheatsheet that aims to explain the full stack. 

Although React Native offers an [excellent tutorial](http://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/android-setup.html) on setting things up, the purpose of this document is to explain the stack in a way that makes sense to new developers.  

Setting up React Native for Android on a Mac
-
####Step 1 - Package Mangers
Since we're on a Mac, we'll first need to install the package managers required to download the tools we'll need.  
- [Homebrew](http://brew.sh/)
- [Node Package Manager](https://nodejs.org/en/)

####Step 2 - Java
Since Android is built on Java, we need to install Java on Mac and the Development Kits

- [Java Development Kit (JDK)](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html)

- [Java for OS X](https://support.apple.com/kb/DL1572?locale=en_US)

####Step 3 - Android
Now that we have Java installed, let's install Android Development Kit

- Install Android SDK using [Homebrew](http://brew.sh)

```
 brew install android-sdk
```

####Step 4 - React Native
Since React Native is a JS framework for building app on Android, let's install it using [Node Package Manager](https://nodejs.org/en/) 

- Install [React Native](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-cli) using [NPM](https://nodejs.org/)

```
 npm install -g react-native-cli
```

#### Step 5 - Install Watchman
The React Native team recommends you do this in order to avoid a strange bug.  
```
 brew install watchman
```


####Step 6 - Android Emulators
While doing development, you'll need an Android emulator to test our of your app.  Let's use [Genymotion (free edition)](https://www.genymotion.com/) as our Android emulator. 

1. Install [VirtualBox Emulator](https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads) then **reboot your computer**. 
2. After your computer is rebooted, then install [Genymotion](https://www.genymotion.com/#!/download) for an Android emulator

####Step 7 - Configure your Mac's environment variables

First create a file for your home environment variables using Terminal [Screen Grab](http://snag.gy/3oawd.jpg)
```
 nano ~/.bash_profile
```
*You can also use ```vi```, ```mate``` or your prefered editor. I just just believe ```nano``` is great for new devs.*

Paste this snippet into ```~/.bash_profile``` [Screen Grab](http://snag.gy/JeSUO.jpg)
```
 # If you installed the SDK via Homebrew, otherwise ~/Library/Android/sdk
 export ANDROID_HOME=/usr/local/opt/android-sdk
```

####Step 8 - Download more packages for Android SDK
This will likely change often so be sure to check up and see which versions of Android you'll need to build for React Native.

- Read [Android Setup for Reach Native](http://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/android-setup.html#configure-your-sdk)

####Step 9 - Install a Debugger for ReactDevelopment
Once you start working on your first React Native app, be sure to install the Google Chrome Debugger.  It will save you tons and tons of headache.

- [React Native Debugger for Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/react-developer-tools/fmkadmapgofadopljbjfkapdkoienihi)

####Optional
Some developers like to use an IDE to write code
- [Android Studio](http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html)

### Resources for streaming radio
- [React Native Audio Player](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-audioplayer)
- [React Native Audio](https://github.com/jsierles/react-native-audio)
- [Build a streaming audio app with React Native](http://www.oreilly.com/pub/e/3483)
